comments.content: Ok, one comment in the article is from an NKU student, as well as an NKU prof, where I happen to go. I think it’s safe to say that a certain person isn’t very well typographically informed, as well as neglecting to acknowledge the fundamental differences between a centuries old craft and Star Wars. Although the Star Wars argument has some merit in my book, and I don’t even own any of them.
Can’t catch a break can ya paul?

_Ironically, the Web has facilitated a renaissance in type design._

(Closing statement.)  
That’s wrong. The renaissance happened before the Web.

it just says “faciliated”, not “was the reason for” or whatever. i’d say that the internet is one part of the ongoing digital revolution, so it surely faciliated any changes in the type industry (just look at distribution and think about your sentence again). well, this is, if you take “type distribution” as a part of type design -\> type industry for me.

(the article is very interesting, i’ll try to answer later on)
